issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
When creating snapshot for volume, error was encountered 'NoSuchBucket'

I did following steps.
(1) Create a volume 
(2) Attache the volume 
(3) Detach the volume 
(4) Took a snapshot and got an error

Cloud Controller's log.
{code}
2016-07-13 15:52:28 ERROR | Data PUT failure to backend for bucketuuid / objectuuid : fc000e97-efd8-48ca-88a0-31b918c39593/57043329-37a4-49ee-a1e8-943bab096da6

This is logs on SC/CC node

comments.body:
I too was unable to reproduce. I used Eucalyptus 4.2.2 with VPC mode and 3Par san as object storage device. Should you have more info on your topology or hit the issue again please reopen.
Thanks.

{code}
[root@c-11 ~]# euca-detach-volume vol-e58a4324
ATTACHMENT	vol-e58a4324	i-06783dd4	/dev/sdf	detaching	2016-07-14T03:34:39.370Z

[root@c-11 ~]# euca-create-snapshot vol-e58a4324
SNAPSHOT	snap-c360e5b3	vol-e58a4324	pending	2016-07-14T03:35:40.854Z	000433437184	1

[root@c-11 ~]# euca-describe-snapshots
SNAPSHOT	snap-c360e5b3	vol-e58a4324	completed	2016-07-14T03:35:40.854Z	100%	000433437184	1
{code}
